name: Mr. Herbert Potechius
short_bio: Herbert Potechius is a academic and researcher based in Germany. He holds a Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering and a Master of Science in Computer Science, both from the Technical University Berlin. Currently, he serves as a research assistant at the University of Applied Sciences Jena, where he is involved in a project funded by the Federal Ministry of Education and Research. The project focuses on the development of AI-related teaching materials suitable for universitystudents across various disciplines. Additionally, Herbert is pursuing his PhD at the same institution, researching the virtualization of shared environments in XR telecommunication scenarios. His work primarily explores color transfer techniques and investigates how the results of these algorithms are subjectively perceived by humans.

name: Dr. Rajasekar V R
college: University of Technology and Applied Sciences, Sur, Oman.
short_bio: Dr. Ashish Kumar has done his Ph.D. on the topic 'Atmospheric Studies using Remote Sensing Techniques and In-Situ Measurements over the Himalayan Region', from IIT Dhanbad in 2019. During his Ph.D. tenure, he worked on the plethora of in-situ, ground and satellite data in the domain of the atmosphere, mainly the aerosols, clouds, precipitation, and associated meteorology over the Himalayan region. He did his M.Tech and B.E. in the field of Electronics & Comm. Engg. To his credit more than 35 technical and scientific publications are there, including refereed journals, conferences, proceedings, etc. He joined ARIES in 2007 as an Engineer. He has taken the engineering responsibilities in the major projects under atmospheric division like ST radar, LiDAR, trace gas, meteorology, etc. He has a significant contribution to the Engineering design development, including instrumentation and data science. He possesses command over different programming languages, and has developed a number of data analysis packages for Atmospheric studies. Additionally, he is also involved in handling and managing the Computer section activities of the institute.

name: Er. Chander Shekhar Sharma
department: Council of Scientific and Industrial Research
college: Institute of Microbial Technology (IMTECH), CSIR-IMTECH, Sector 39A, Chandigarh
short_bio: Chander Shekhar Sharma is a seasoned professional with a passion for scientific exploration and technological innovation. Currently serving as a Senior Scientist at CSIR IMTECH, Chandigarh, his expertise spans various domains, with a primary focus on Smart IoT devices, network administration, and cybersecurity. With additional responsibilities as the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), he ensures the organization's integrity and security of digital assets. Furthermore, he is entrusted with the pivotal role of Principal Project Coordinator (Investigator) for the Science, Technology, and Innovation Hub in Leh Ladakh, which receives funding from the Department of Science and Technology (DST). In this capacity, he orchestrates collaborative efforts to foster scientific advancements and technological breakthroughs in the Ladakh region. Beyond his technical responsibilities, Mr. Sharma is deeply committed to science communication and dissemination. Leveraging electronic media channels, he effectively communicates complex scientific concepts to diverse audiences, bridging the gap between scientific research and public understanding. Moreover, Mr. Sharma spearheads the 'Jigyasa' program, facilitating meaningful interactions between scientists and students. This initiative nurtures budding talent and fosters a culture of scientific inquiry and exploration among the youth. With an illustrious career spanning 17 years, Mr. Sharma has honed his skills through diverse roles in various research and development institutions. His journey reflects a steadfast dedication to advancing scientific knowledge, promoting cybersecurity best practices, and fostering innovation-driven ecosystems.

name: Dr. Ashish Kumar
college: Aryabhatta Research Institute of observational sciences, Nainital, Uttarakhand 263001
short_bio: Dr. Ashish Kumar has done his Ph.D. on the topic 'Atmospheric Studies using Remote Sensing Techniques and In-Situ Measurements over the Himalayan Region', from IIT Dhanbad in 2019. During his Ph.D. tenure, he worked on the plethora of in-situ, ground and satellite data in the domain of the atmosphere, mainly the aerosols, clouds, precipitation, and associated meteorology over the Himalayan region. He did his M.Tech and B.E. in the field of Electronics & Comm. Engg. To his credit more than 35 technical and scientific publications are there, including refereed journals, conferences, proceedings, etc. He joined ARIES in 2007 as an Engineer. He has taken the engineering responsibilities in the major projects under atmospheric division like ST radar, LiDAR, trace gas, meteorology, etc. He has a significant contribution to the Engineering design development, including instrumentation and data science. He possesses command over different programming languages, and has developed a number of data analysis packages for Atmospheric studies. Additionally, he is also involved in handling and managing the Computer section activities of the institute.

name: Dr. Praveen Kumar P
short_bio: Dr. P. Praveen Kumar is a Scientist in Advanced Systems Laboratory of DRDO at Hyderabad. He was awarded a PhD in Applied Mechanics from IIT Delhi. His current areas of research include solid mechanics, composite materials, material modeling, FEM and computational modeling. He taught courses on “Aerospace Structures” and “Missile Structures” for M.Tech (Aerospace Engineering) at Defence Institute of Advanced Technology (Deemed University), Pune. He received the Laboratory Scientist of the year award for the year 2020.

name: Ms. Prathyusha
department: Department of Medical Devices and Engineering
college: Division of Polymeric Medical Devices, SCTIMST
short_bio: Ms. Prathyusha's academic achievements include second place in the MSc Biotechnology (2018), qualification for the GATE 2018 and JOINT CSIR-UGC NET test 2019, and fourth rank in the BSc BT & SP (2016). Distinction was achieved in both secondary and higher secondary education. Since school, she has passed numerous competitive tests, such as PCM and Orchard. Additionally, she earned a certificate of appreciation for organizing and carrying out seminars and conferences. Prizes were received for poster presentations in the respective fields. Recently, she won first place in a poster presentation at the International Biotechnology Conclave-Biozion, co-hosted by the Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences & Technology and the College of Agriculture, Vellayani, Kerala Agricultural University, Thiruvananthapuram. Currently employed by SCTIMST as a research student in the medical devices and engineering department, focusing on the development of polymeric biomedical devices for use in wound healing, including drug delivery to the created scaffold to improve its ability to heal wounds. Additionally, she completed her postgraduate research at the Department of Marine Biotechnology, CMFRI, on 'Partial mitogenome characterizations of purple-colored shovel-nosed lobster Thenus unimaculatus, Burton and Davie 2007,' using bioinformatic techniques.

name: Er. Jithin Krishnan
college: Division of Medical Instrumentation, BMT Wing, SCTIMST
short_bio: Jithin Krishnan is currently working as a Scientist/Engineer at Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences and Technology, An Institute of National Importance under Gov. of India. He is working as a specialist research engineer in the Division of Medical Instrumentation. His core expertise areas are active implants and sensors, Ultra low power electronic circuits, Electromagnetic Interference and Mitigation strategies etc. He has more than 12 years of experience in active implantable medical devices, particularly in the area of Neuroprosthetic devices and allied passive devices. He has 6 granted patents,3 design registrations and has filed 16 patent applications so far. He has 10 international journal publications too. He has served as the Expert Panel Member for the Evaluation of the Swadeshi Microprocessor Challenge, a Pan-India contest with more than 100K entries conducted by the Ministry of Electronics and Communication. He also served as the Expert Panel member for Defence Innovation Organization, Ministry of Defence, Government of India for IDEX -Defence India Startup Challenge for 2021,2022. Recently he was awarded the BRICS Young Scientist 23 and was part of the Indian Delegation for BRICS Conclave 23 happened in South Africa.

name: Ms. Athira Murali
college: Biomedical Technology Wing, Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences and Technology
short_bio: Ms. Athira Murali is a research scholar at the Biomedical Technology Wing, Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences and Technology, Thiruvananthapuram, India. Her Master's in Chemistry was pursued at the University of Kerala, India. Her areas of research include 3D printing of polymers and composites and bone tissue engineering. Currently, 3D printing of polymer composites, their physico-chemical characterization, and biocompatibility evaluation are being worked on by her.

name: Dr. Moirangthem Marjit
department: Department of Computer Science and Engineering
college: North Eastern Regional Institute of Science and Technology
short_bio: Dr. Moirangthem Marjit Singh is currently an Associate Professor in Computer Science & Engineering Department at North Eastern Regional Institute of Science & Technology (NERIST), Arunachal Pradesh, India. He received B.Tech. and M.Tech. in Computer Science & Engineering degrees from NERIST and was awarded Gold Medal for securing top position in M.Tech. He received his PhD (Engineering) degree in computer Science and Engineering from University of Kalyani, West Bengal,India. He was the Head of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, NERIST during 2018 to 2022. He was also the founder Honorary Joint Secretary of the Institution of Engineers, Arunachal Pradesh State Centre, India during 2019-2021. Dr. Marjit is a Fellow of IETE New Delhi, India and Fellow of the Institutions of Engineers (India) and the senior member IEEE, USA. Dr. Marjit was honored with “Academic Excellence Award” by Taylor's University, Malaysia in recognition of his outstanding academic performance on 13 September 2023 at Taylor's University in association International Conference on Evolutionary Artificial Intelligence (ICEAI 2023). He was awarded the IE(I) Young Engineers Award 2014-2015 from the Computer Engineering Division, Institution of Engineers, India. He received the Best Paper Awards at international conferences namely the ICEAI 2023(held at Taylors' University, Malaysia) and the ICACCT 2016, (held at APIIT, India) published by springer. Dr. Marjit secured First Position in X and Second Position in XII Examinations conducted by CBSE, New Delhi, India, amongst the candidates sent up from Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalayas (JNVs) of North Eastern region states of India, in 1995 and 1997, respectively. He was awarded the Gold Medal for getting top position in the M.Tech.(CSE) at NERIST in 2010 He has more than 20 years of teaching and research experience. He has published several research papers in journals and conferences of repute. He has organized/associated with several technical conferences held in India and abroad. His research interests include mobile adhoc networks, wireless sensor networks, network security, AI, machine learning, and deep learning.

name: Dr. Veningston K
department: Department of Computer Science and Engineering
short_bio: Veningston K received a Ph.D. degree in Computer Science and Engineering from Anna University, Chennai, INDIA in 2015 and is currently Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at National Institute of Technology Srinagar, INDIA. His expertise areas include design and implementation of Computer Vision (CV) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) systems using machine learning and deep learning algorithms. His current work includes CV applications in health, clean India and NLP applications in legal domain. He is a recipient of prestigious INSPIRE fellowship by the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India in 2011. He has chaired technical sessions in several international conferences within and outside India and delivered numerous technical talks on the areas of his research. He has published over 20 research papers in reputed journals and conferences, besides undertaking a research project being contributed to the Swachh Bharat mission of Government of India.

name: Er. Akoramurthy B
short_bio: Full-time Ph.D. Scholar (Visvesvaraya Fellowship) of the Institute registered vide No. CS22D1005 dated 01/02/2023 under the supervision of Dr.B. Surendiran, Associate Professor of Computer Science &  Engineering, National Institute of Technology Puducherry.

name: Dr. Geetha G
short_bio: Dr. G. Geetha , an energetic academician, a vibrant researcher and a dynamic administrator had 20+ years of experience. She is a recognised supervisor with 45 publications in IEEE, Scopus and SCI journals and 8 PHD scholars awarded with her guidance and received two patent grants. She has received funds from MHRD, AICTE and IE India. She has organized various workshops, seminars,guest lectures, FDP's and conferences in current trends. She had various administrative positions such as Head of Department, Head of IPR Cell and Dean Innovation To add feather to her cap, she is a trained scientist by Indian patent office, Chennai under Kiran IPR Women Scientist C Scheme. She has also done Patent related courses in NPTEL and WIPO PCT Distance learning courses. Around 3000+ students, 400+ Faculties, 15+ institutions have benefited from her guidance in filing a patent . She has conducted 50+ seminars, 10 FDP's , 5 Workshops in Intellectual property rights.

name: Dr. Balaji C
short_bio: Balaji Chandrasekaran received his BE degree in computer science and engineering from Anna University, Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India, in 2009; his ME degree in software engineering from Anna University, Tiruchirappalli, Tamil Nadu, India, in 2011, and his PhD degree in computer applications from National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli, Tamil Nadu, India, in 2019. Currently, he is working as an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Anna University CEG Campus, Tamil Nadu, India. His main research interests are cryptography, cloud computing, and information security.

name: Dr. Kaviyarasu Ayakkannu
short_bio: Dr. A. Kaviyarasu obtained his Doctorate from Anna University in Chennai. For the past fourteen years, he has worked as an Assistant Professor in the Division of Avionics at the Department of Aerospace Engineering, MIT campus, Anna University. He completed his research program and master's degree (Avionics) in the same department. Dr. Kaviyarasu's areas of interest are UAV modeling & simulation and Avionics systems. He is one of the active members of the team 'DHAKSHA,' a small unmanned aerial vehicle developed by his team that has been utilized for various civil and military applications. He has been involved in multiple development activities. He has been awarded by former Indian President Dr. A.P.J Abdul Kalam for his innovative ideas, skills, and contribution to science and technology. The former Vice Chancellor of Anna University also awarded him the 'Excellence in Innovation' award for his contribution to the field of Unmanned Aerial Vehicles. Dr. Kaviyarasu has published over 17 papers in reputed international journals and 15 at national and international conferences. Currently, he is working on the Robot Operating System (ROS) and Swarm of Drones. As a part of his academic activities, he is interested in radio communication, antennas, and home brewing.

name: Dr. Sriram S R
short_bio: S. R. Sriram received a Ph.D. degree in Nanoelectronics from VIT University, Chennai. He received an M.E. degree in VLSI design from Anna University. He is currently working as an Assistant Professor in College of Engineering Guindy, Anna University, Chennai, Department of ECE. He was an Assistant Professor with the SRM Easwari Engineering College and SKP Institute of Technology. He is a recognized research supervisor from Anna University, Faculty of Information and Communication Engineering. He worked as JRF in VIT Chennai under the DST-SERB project, “Development of a Modelling Framework for Variability-Aware Design of Strained FinFET-based Mixed Signal Circuits.” He published nine SCI journals and four IEEE conferences and published a patent, “Techniques to Protect Electronic Circuit Boards from Maturization.” His current research interests are semiconductor device modeling and analog circuit design, developing analytical models of variability and reliability effects in non-classical MOSFETs, and investigation of these effects in CMOS VLSI circuits.

name: Dr. Sudhakar T
short_bio: Dr.T.Sudhakar is working as an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Technology, Anna University, MIT campus, Chennai. He completed his Doctoral degree at Anna University in the year 2020 in the faculty of information and communication engineering. He has published several research articles in various reputed international journals and conferences. He has more than 17 years of teaching experience and research experience. His research interests include Cryptography and network security, Cyber security, Image processing, and deep learning.

name: Er. Thamodharan Arumugam
department: NGN Lab, Department of Computer Technology
short_bio: Thamodharan Arumugam is a Ph.D. student who possesses 10+ years of experience in the medical field with India's premier medical institutions such as AIIMS, NIMHANS, PGI Chandigarh, JIPMER, Sree Chitra, etc. Additionally, he is keen on learning medical concepts and IoT-based techniques to apply in real-world scenarios. He is currently working on cancer patients' heart failure prediction using deep learning concepts and aims to generate an IoT-based device for the same purpose. He has a good educational background.

name: Dr. Arun Kumar A
department: School of Computer Science Engineering and Information Systems (SCORE)
short_bio: Arunkumar Arulappan is working as an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Science Engineering and Information Systems (SCORE) at Vellore Institute of Technology, Vellore, India. He received a Ph.D. degree from the Faculty of Information and Communication Engineering, Anna University, Chennai, India, in 2023 and his B.Tech in Information Technology at Anna University and M.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering at Vellore Institute of Technology. His research interests include the Cloud-native deployment, SDN, NFV, 5G/6G Networks, AI/ML based Networking, Internet of Vehicles, and UAV Communications. He is proficient with simulator tools MATLAB, ns-3, Mininet, OpenNet VM, and P4 programming. He is exposed to open source tools such as OpenStack, Cloudify, OPNFV, and Cloud-Native Computing Foundation (CNCF).

name: Dr. Sahaya Beni Prathiba
department: SCOPE, Centre for Cyber Physical Systems
college: School of Computer Science and Engineering, VIT, Chennai
short_bio: Dr. Sahaya Beni Prathiba received Bachelor's and Master's degrees in Computer Science and Engineering from Anna University, Chennai. She secured the 23rd rank among 2581 candidates in the Master of Engineering program. In the year 2022, she completed her Ph.D. at Anna University, Chennai. Currently, she is working as an Assistant Professor at the Centre for Cyber Physical Systems, School of Computer Science and Engineering, Vellore Institute of Technology, Chennai. She was also a recipient of the Anna Centenary Research Fellowship. Her research interests include 5G/6G, Vehicle-to-Everything, Software Defined Networking, Autonomous Vehicular Networks, Industry 5.0, and Metaverse. She serves as a reviewer for IEEE TRANSACTIONS and reputed Elsevier journals.

name: Er. Sreenivas Rao
college: Society for Electronics Transactions and Security, Chennai
short_bio: Sreenivas R is presently serving for the Society for Electronics Transactions and Security (SETS). He has completed his MCA from VIT Chennai and has worked on projects in various domains. During his coursework, he published a paper in the field of Medical Imaging using Computer Vision. Additionally, he authored three chapters, two of which have been provisionally accepted, with the second being in the field of Medical Imaging. Throughout his tenure at the workplace, he has trained various models from scratch for confidential projects, including LLama2 and Bloom 560m models. He believes that participating in this workshop will be highly beneficial for himself to contribute towards projects related to the healthcare domain.

name: Dr. Kalimuthu Karuppanan
short_bio: Dr. K. Kalimuthu is working as a Research Assistant Professor in Department of Biotechnology at SRM Institute of Science and Technology, KTR campus. His research focuses on developing protein and peptide based therapeutics for infectious (e.g. Ebola, Anthrax, SARS CoV-2) and metabolic (e.g. Lung, Cardiovascular Inflammation) diseases.

name: Prof. Muhammad Haroon Yousaf
college: University of Engineering and Technology Taxila, Pakistan
short_bio: Prof Muhammad Haroon Yousaf is currently working as a Professor of Computer Engineering at University of Engineering and Technology Taxila. He is the Director/Principal Investigator of Swarm Robotics Lab under the National Centre of Robotics & Automation (NCRA).  His research interests are in computer vision research particularly in the areas of object detection, object recognition, scene understanding, action/activity recognition, Robotics and multi-modal recognition. He is also working as Associate Editor of IEEE Transactions on Circuits and Systems on Video Technology (TCSVT), and Academic Editor of Mathematical Problems in Engineering journal. He is the recipient of the Best University Teacher Award by the Higher Education Commission for the years 2012-2013.

name: Mr. Stephen McIlvanna
designation: PhD Student, Centre for Autonomous Manufacturing Systems (i-AMS)
department: School of Electronics, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
short_bio: Stephen Mcllvanna received the MEng degree in Electrical and Electronic Engineering from Queen’s University Belfast in 2007. He is currently pursuing the Ph.D. degree at Queen’s University. His research interests are safety critical control of autonomous systems incorporating machine learning techniques.

name: Prof Seán McLoone
designation: Director, Centre for Autonomous Manufacturing Systems (i-AMS), Director, Energy, Power and Intelligent Control Research Centre (EPIC)
department: School of Electronics, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
short_bio: Prof Seán McLoone is Professor of Applied Computational Intelligence and Director of the Centre for Intelligent Autonomous Manufacturing Systems (i-AMS) at Queen’s University Belfast. He is also Director of the Energy, Power and Intelligent Control (EPIC) Research Centre within the School of Electronics, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at Queen’s University Belfast. Prof McLoone’s research interests are in computational intelligence techniques, machine learning and data analytics with applications in advanced manufacturing and power systems.  His research has a strong application focus, with many projects undertaken in collaboration with industry in areas such as process monitoring, control, optimisation, time series prediction, and in-line sensor characterization.  At a professional level, Prof. McLoone is a Chartered Engineer, a Fellow of the Institute of Engineering Technology (IET), and a Senior Member of the Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers (IEEE). He is a member of the IFAC Technical Committees on Computational Intelligence in Control (TC3.2), and Modelling, Identification and Signal Processing (TC1.1) and has previously served as Member of the Accreditation Board of Engineers Ireland and as a non-executive Director on the Board of Directors of Irish Manufacturing Research Ltd. He currently serves as an Associate Editor for the ‘Transactions of the Institute of Measurement and Control’ and as a member of the Editorial Board of ‘Engineering Applications of Artificial Intelligence’
